sect1.title: Install a Unix-like system and supporting software

sect2.title: a Unix-like system
sect2.para: Most of the documentation in this section is kept as a reference. More up-to-date documentation is in the install sections in the Wiki.
You will need a computer running a unix-like system with the following software installed:

listitem.para: tcl --if you plan to use the OpenACS installation script
gmake and the compile and build environment.

note.title: BSD Note
note.para: BSD users: in most places in these instructions, gmake will work better than make. (more information on FreeBSD installation). Also, fetch is a native replacement for wget.

sect2.para: Note: Instructions for installing tDOM and threaded Tcl are included with the AOLserver4 installation instructions, if these are not yet installed.
The following programs may be useful or required for some configurations. They are included in most distributions:

listitem.para: ImageMagick (used by some packages for server side image manipulation)
DocBook and supporting software (and install emacs keybindings for DocBook SGML)
a Mail Transport Agent, such as exim or sendmail (or install qmail from source)

sect2.para: In order to cut and paste the example code into your shell, you must first do .
To install a machine to the specifications of the Reference Platform, do the walkthrough of the Red Hat 8.0 Install for OpenACS.
